Tavatron snarled softly. She blindly snapped at the air in front of 
her, twisting and turning, doing her best to loosen her captor's
grip. 
Her hind legs frantically scratched and clawed at the floor. She was 
getting desperate. She hated not being able to see her captors, it
put 
her at a severe disadvantage. 

Tavatron sontinued to claw and snap at the air surrounding her, 
unaware of the current situation. Suddenly something in the darkness 
spoke. She couldn't tell who exactly, all the voices and shadows were 
beginning to blend, but that didn't matter. She heard the words 
'torture' and 'Tavatron' in the same sentence. The fluid in her 
artificial viens froze. Torture. She had always been able to avoid 
capture until now. As a former Predacon she had been trained to 
withstand most forms of torture, but the Aliiance was different. They 
weren't the Predacons.

Tavatron's body tensed as Punch pressed his gun against her. This was 
the third time someone had threatened to shoot her unless they 
cooperated. However this time she would rather be shot and have it 
done with than be locked in some cell for Primus knows how long. 
Tavatron found herself thinking about the last time she had seen 
Dinobot. He was asleep, or so it appeared. Perhaps she should have 
waited for him to rise. Who knows, she may never see him again. A
pity 
too, she was actually beginning to care for him as more than a
friend. 
Whether or not he felt that way about her, well, judging from the way 
he acted most of the time she'd have to say no, but then again he was 
a warrior. Emotion wasn't a trait found in most warriors, perhaps he 
did care for her, he just had an odd way of showing it. 

Tavatron growled softly, no matter what happens next they were
getting 
out of here, ALIVE. Tavatron cringed at the sound of a blunt object 
hitting metal, the object hit most likely being Iron Raptor:

"Leave her alone. If you kill her then you will have nothing to 
bargain with."

*First priority, keep Iron Raptor safe and alive,* Tavatron thought 
solemnly, *at all costs.*
